original: Nucleic acids** are vital components of DNA, the primary substance for storing genetic information, typically located in the cell nucleus. DNA governs the metabolic processes of the cell and consists of two complementary antiparallel strands formed by varying sequences of nucleotides.
sampled: </s>Nucleic acids** are vital components of DNA, the primary substance for storing genetic</s> insight, typically located in the cell</s> anchor. DNA governs the metabolic processes of the cell and consists of two complementary antiparallel</s> conduits formed by varying sequences</s> for nucleotides.
